intro: Filago cavanillesii, commonly known as the Cavanilles' filago, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Filago cavanillesii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
